Package org.neo4j.bolt.runtime

Interface BoltConnection

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultBoltConnection
    public interface BoltConnection

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      io.netty.channel.Channel channel()
      Returns the underlying raw netty channel
      void enqueue​(Job job)
      Adds submitted job to the job queue for execution (at the earliest time possible)
      void handleSchedulingError​(Throwable t)
      Invoked when an exception is caught during the scheduling of the pending jobs.
      boolean hasPendingJobs()
      Returns whether there's any pending Job waiting to be processed
      String id()
      Returns a unique, not changing over time string that can safely be used to identify this connection.
      boolean idle()
      Returns whether this connection is idle or not.
      void initKeepAliveTimer()
      Init the keep alive timer.
      void interrupt()
      Interrupt and (possibly) stop the current running job, but continue processing next jobs
      void keepAlive()
      Perform a keep alive check
      SocketAddress localAddress()
      Returns the local (server) socket address that this client is bound to
      boolean processNextBatch()
      Executes a batch of queued jobs, which is executed in an another thread (which is part of a thread pool)
      SocketAddress remoteAddress()
      Returns the remote (client) socket address that this client established the connection from.
      void start()
      Executes extra initialisation routines before taking this connection into use
      void stop()
      Stops this connection

    • Method Detail

      • id

        String id()
        Returns a unique, not changing over time string that can safely be used to identify this connection.
        Returns:
        identifier

      • idle

        boolean idle()
        Returns whether this connection is idle or not.
        Returns:
        true if idle, false otherwise

      • localAddress

        SocketAddress localAddress()
        Returns the local (server) socket address that this client is bound to
        Returns:
        local endpoint

      • remoteAddress

        SocketAddress remoteAddress()
        Returns the remote (client) socket address that this client established the connection from.
        Returns:
        remote endpoint

      • channel

        io.netty.channel.Channel channel()
        Returns the underlying raw netty channel
        Returns:
        netty channel

      • hasPendingJobs

        boolean hasPendingJobs()
        Returns whether there's any pending Job waiting to be processed
        Returns:
        true when there's at least one job in the queue

      • start

        void start()
        Executes extra initialisation routines before taking this connection into use

      • enqueue

        void enqueue​(Job job)
        Adds submitted job to the job queue for execution (at the earliest time possible)
        Parameters:
        job - the job to be added

      • processNextBatch

        boolean processNextBatch()
        Executes a batch of queued jobs, which is executed in an another thread (which is part of a thread pool)
        Returns:
        false when no more processing should take place (i.e. connection is closed)

      • handleSchedulingError

        void handleSchedulingError​(Throwable t)
        Invoked when an exception is caught during the scheduling of the pending jobs. The caught exception would mostly be RejectedExecutionException which is thrown by the thread pool executor when it fails to accept submitted jobs
        Parameters:
        t - the exception occurred during scheduling

      • interrupt

        void interrupt()
        Interrupt and (possibly) stop the current running job, but continue processing next jobs

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stops this connection

      • keepAlive

        void keepAlive()
        Perform a keep alive check

      • initKeepAliveTimer

        void initKeepAliveTimer()
        Init the keep alive timer.
